item.title: 'Havana syndrome' possibly linked to Russian intelligence, media report finds
item.description: A new joint investigation by The Insider, Der Spiegel and CBS’s 60 Minutes suggests the mysterious syndrome, which has affected several US diplomats in recent years, is linked to a Russian intelligence unit.

item.title: All eyes on Sinner as he takes home another victory at the Masters
item.description: Jannik Sinner's stellar performance in 2024 continued as he clinched the Miami Open title with a 6-3, 6-1 victory over 11th seed Grigor Dimitrov on Sunday.

item.title: France and China discuss trade and Ukraine ahead of Xi Jinping visit
item.description: The meeting between the French foreign minister and his Chinese counterpart comes ahead of a Chinese leader Xi Jinping's planned visit to France.

item.title: Bucha remembers fallen servicemen in city's second liberation anniversary
item.description: Mourners gathered with flowers at the city's cemetery to pay their respects. At least 270 people were buried there.

item.title: WATCH: Inside Berlin's Disgusting Food Museum
item.description: Snake wine, snails or bull’s penis might not be something for you, but others find them delicious.

item.description: Remains of Emile who went missing from the small French alpine village of Le Vernet last July were found over the weekend.

item.description: Russian strikes left hundreds of thousands without power in the region of Odesa on Easter Sunday.
